body:
More setup infos:
All sync is currently done
Folder share between : 
A : the friend's machine showing this bug
B : my Ubuntu14-64 0.14.42 desktop shows global 90 files, 1 folder, 3GB, connection to A blinks and when reconnect B synch's quickly to A up to 99% 128B
C : my laptop Ubuntu14-64 0.14.43-rc1 with 2 Ignore files for this folder (shows global 91 files, 1 folder ~5GB; local 88 files, 1 folder 400MB), + usual (?i)(?d)Thumbs.db & (?i)(?d)Desktop*.ini
Both my 2 B & C devices are on the same LAN and show Uptodate to each other (although this strange 90/91). 
O : some other friends (only one online ATM being 14.43-rc1 (Win7 not sure))
A<->B<->C
A<->O
B<->O

```
Panic at 2018-01-09T14:46:25+01:00
panic: bug: removed more than added
	panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal 0xc0000005 code=0x0 addr=0x20 pc=0x975b46]

goroutine 1368 [running]:
```

Cool double panic, but root cause is probably something wrong with my persistent accounting stuff.

Cool? Means easier to dig ? Would you need the log from the 2nd panicking device? It is
"...
[G2G2G] 13:15:52 INFO: Joined relay relay://163.172.179.61:8443
Panic at 2018-01-09T13:15:57+01:00
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x8337bb]
..."
Yeah, posting which part panics would be nice.

I guess some bad fun to redact this one a coherent way :(
Maybe these are 2 different issues, but I'll post this 2nd log close in timestamp to the other
Ok, I work

Here is the cooking . On this Ub14-42, panicking ended on this logfile
[panic-20180109-131557.log](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/1616878/panic-20180109-131557.log)
This is fixed in the latest version. Also, we usually don't need the log prior the panic,so no point obfuscating things we don't need.

So it is advised to upgrade my ub14-42 to 14.43 quickly?
Good to know. This #4659 remains open because of the first log (the 14.43 Win10 machine)?
Or the panic in 43 machine is because of my own 42 ?
No. The two panics are unrelated, but one of them is fixed.

Now, one remote device removed 2 big files
B shows local+global 88/1/391MiB Up to date
C shows local 88/1/391MiB Up to date + global 89/1/2.50GiB, the delta being the size of one of the 2 removed files, which were both really removed everywhere in the shared-folder. On C I removed all Ignores

Update info
All nodes have now switch to v.0.14.43 and are set at autoupdate Stable, but C (43 +set rc autoupdate) and the folder initiator node which is one from the O friends (O1), is Ub Mate 17 or 18 x86 and is still non updated at 0.14.40 level (syncthing stable repo). This one didn't went up since B & C saw it on for the last time (I'm not sure O1-B link for the share is accepted at O1 side).
I fogot to say at the initiation time, C-O link for the share was R/W effective on both sides, and there is nor was Read only nodes in the cluster for the share. I removed C-O later.
Yesterday night, I removed the share on C then recreated it just like it was the minute before (single link to B).
C immediately became uptodate with B (same as B shows with C), global/local 88-1-391MiB/88-1-391MiB, and B now shows g/l 89-1-391/88-1-391MiB (I didn't say what local was on B on the beginning)... I'll update today when O1 is up I hope. Bye

BTW, B machine won't panic anymore since 42 upgraded to 43. now all machines in the cluster show global=local but B still showing global=local+1
A still panics
Is A the first panic you posted?
Yes it is, Audrius

About B global/local mismatch, this may probably be not related to the A panic, but instead to mismatch ignores in the cluster* as stated in ignores documentation and #623 + #624 . Sorry if that was confusing

* there are mostly windows involved in this folder share and I don't want these weird *.lnk | *.ini | *.db in my nuxes ;-) . Case sensitivity differences may be another reason. Not a real issue in itself.
I'm currently waiting for the friend's A machine new logs and config ....

EDIT : let me know it's better I remove the ref to 623 and/or 624 above to not disturb in further reading of these.

News : 
A upgraded to 014.43 release
Still panic
started st with `-paused` .... => quiet, no panic :)
resumed all shares & devices one at a time, keeping the presume culprit (B) for the end
All quiet and UpToDate/connected until I resumed B => panic
Deleted on A the shared folder with B and recreated => OK uptodate on A, BUT it only showed local=global = 16 files when the global is 106.
But on B, when I added a file, I saw B pushing ~400MiB to A (online with no traffic)
Removed the folder on B and recreated : all is nice now, even local=global
BTW, there was something wrong (non blocking) in A conf I did myself : on A side, UPnP is disabled. There was a mismatch in router port-fw and ST non-default port.
@calmh any ideas?

I am getting the same panic message ("removed more than added"). Here is my log: 
[panic-20180123-155433.log](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/1656437/panic-20180123-155433.log). I noticed this today, but I hadn't used the machine (a laptop) for a few days, so I don't really know what event triggered this.
@khinsen Does this happen on every start? Then please run with `STTRACE=model,db` environment variable set - hopefully seeing what's happening up to the panic reveals the problem.

Yes, the panic is reproducible. Here is the extended log: 
[panic-20180123-174412.log](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/1656807/panic-20180123-174412.log)

@khinsen Does this go away if you set `STDBCHECKEVERY=0`? E.g.,

```
$ STDBCHECKEVERY=0 syncthing
```

from the terminal, assuming it's not already running.
No. Same panic.

Then I suspect some sort of effect from @imsodins various changes, maybe something around the ingored things and then conversion to that, rather than my persistent stuff which would also be a prime suspect.
